titles.title: To amend the South Pacific Tuna Act of 1988 to provide for duty-free treatment of canned tuna imported into the United States that was caught by certain vessels and processed in certain facilities.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

committee.name: House Committee on Ways and Means

action.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Trade.

committee.name: House Committee on Ways and Means

action.text: Executive Comment Requested from Treasury, State, USDA, Commerce, ITC, USTR.

committee.name: House Committee on Ways and Means

bill.summary: 11/20/1993--Introduced. Amends the South Pacific Tuna Act of 1988 to grant duty-free treatment, provided certain eligibility requirements are met, to light meat tuna (prepared or preserved in airtight containers in any manner, except in oil) imported from any Pacific Island Party.
